New Records: Georgia secured their biggest-ever Euro win with a 2-0 victory over Portugal, marking their debut in a major tournament.
Khwicha Kvaratskhelia scored Georgia's first goal in the second minute, and Georges Mikautadze later converted a penalty to become the top scorer at Euro 2024 with three goals.
Key Match Events: Georgia took the lead in the second minute with a goal by Khwicha Kvaratskhelia.
Portugal's Cristiano Ronaldo, playing in a largely second-string lineup, struggled to score and was substituted in the second half.
Georges Mikautadze scored a decisive penalty in the 53rd minute after a VAR-awarded foul.
Pre-Game Insights: Georgia entered the match as significant underdogs, ranked 74th in FIFA rankings, but had recently won their Nations League group and a playoff to reach the tournament.
Portugal, ranked 6th in the world and European champions in 2016, fielded a largely second-string lineup with only three starters from their 3-0 win over Turkey.
Georgia's coach Willy Sagnol emphasized the team's confidence as the underdog and highlighted their resilience in the tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Georgia's players and staff celebrated wildly after the win, reflecting the significance of their historic achievement.
Cristiano Ronaldo's failure to score marked the first time in his career that he did not score in the group stage of a major international tournament.
Portugal's performance raised questions about their reliance on key players and their preparation for the knockout stages.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at VELTINS-Arena in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, with an attendance of 49,616 fans.
Georgia's win set up a Round of 16 clash against Spain, three-time Euro winners.
The game also impacted other teams' knockout stages, including England, Romania, and Slovenia.
